summary: I have a background in economics, sustainable development and international development. During my studies I developed a great interest in the role of the private sector in combatting injustice, social exclusion and promoting poverty alleviation in developing countries, through sustainable and fair means. I’m a hard worker and a team player. I have experience in organizing and executing research projects. In addition, the experience of living in different countries helps me to adapt to different environments.

projects: [{'title': 'Report on refugees from Syria', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'Together with five other students, I developed a report about important aspects that are normally ignored on the debate about refugees from Syria in Europe. My tasks not only include writing articles, but also co-coordinating the work of the group. It included the editing of the report.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Pedro', 'last_name': 'Valarini', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Program Coordinator at ICCO Cooperation'}]}, {'title': 'Research on Syrian refugees in Istanbul, Turkey', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'For my master thesis I carried out an independent research entitled “Time to Restart: The experience of Syrian refugees in establishing a business in Istanbul”. The aim of this research was to bring more information about the situation Syrian refugees in Istanbul. This research gave particular attention to the role of co-ethnic networks on the process to open and run a business. This research was part of a bigger project involving other four colleagues who did research on Syrian refugees in Turkey and Greece, but in different topics. The project aimed to share information in order to have a deeper understanding of the experience of refugees on the border of Europe.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Pedro', 'last_name': 'Valarini', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Program Coordinator at ICCO Cooperation'}]}, {'title': 'Research on rural migrants in Kigali, Rwanda', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'description': "RurbanAfrica is a project that explores the connections between rural transformations, mobility, and urbanization processes and analyze how these contribute to an understanding of the scale, nature and location of poverty in sub-Saharan Africa. As part of my studies I went to Rwanda for 3 months. There I've done research about the migration from rural areas of the country to the city of Kigali. Once there I had to conduct interviews with local population and the result of these interviews was translated in a policy report for my university.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Pedro', 'last_name': 'Valarini', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Program Coordinator at ICCO Cooperation'}]}]
